snippet: The abrupt resignation of the director of the state’s health insurance marketplace is the latest in a series of top-level departures from troubled state-run exchanges.
abstract: April Todd-Malmlov, director of Minnesota's health insurance exchange, abruptly resigns, making it the fourth state program to see a leadership change in the midst of mounting criticism over the rollout of Pres Obama's new health care law.
lead_paragraph: The abrupt resignation of the director of the state’s health insurance marketplace is the latest in a series of top-level departures from troubled state-run exchanges.

headline.main: Minnesota Becomes Fourth State to Lose Chief of Exchange
headline.print_headline: Fourth State Abruptly Loses Chief of Exchange

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
